title: Douglas Coupland - 14 books (epub, mobi)
description:
**by request**


Fourteen books by Douglas Coupland. All are in epub and mobi formats except Generation X, which is pdf format. And it's not a very good pdf.


All Families Are Psychotic (2001)
Eleanor Rigby (2004)
Generation A (2009)
Generation X (1991)
Girlfriend in a Coma (1998)
The Gum Thief (2007)
Hey Nostradamus! (2003)
JPod (2006)
Marshall McLuhan: You Know Nothing of My Work! (2009)
Microserfs (1995)
Miss Wyoming (2000)
Player One: What Is to Become of Us (2010)
Polaroids From the Dead (1996)
Shampoo Planet (1992)


about the author:

Douglas Coupland (born December 30, 1961) is a Canadian novelist. His fiction is complemented by recognized works in design and visual art arising from his early formal training. His first novel, the 1991 international bestseller Generation X: Tales for an Accelerated Culture, popularized terms such as McJob and Generation X. A specific feature of Coupland's novels is their synthesis of postmodern religion, Web 2.0 technology, human sexuality, and pop culture.

Coupland lives in West Vancouver, British Columbia with his partner David Weir. He published his twelfth novel Generation A in 2009. He also released an updated version of City of Glass and a biography on Marshall McLuhan for Penguin Canada in their Extraordinary Canadians series, called Extraordinary Canadians: Marshall McLuhan. He is the presenter of the 2010 Massey Lectures, and a companion novel to the lectures, Player One Ã¢â‚¬â€œ What Is to Become of Us: A Novel in Five Hours. Coupland has been longlisted twice for the Scotiabank Giller Prize in 2006 and 2010, respectively. was a finalist for the Writers' Trust Fiction Prize in 2009, and was nominated for the Hubert Evans Non-Fiction Prize in 2011 for Extraordinary Canadians: Marshall McLuhan.
